questions.question: Who is responsible for inspecting diets supplied to prisoners to ensure satisfactory meals are provided within the allowed cost?
questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 8.10.5.

questions.question: What is the maximum duration that should elapse between meals for prisoners, under normal circumstances, according to the policy?
questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 8.10.7.

questions.question: According to Rule 7 (4) of the Jamaica Constabulary Force Book of Rules, what must be done when escorting a prisoner over any long period of time or distance?

options.b: Ensure the prisoner is deprived of meals
options.c: Supply the prisoner with their regular diet as if they were confined to an institution

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.10.8.

questions.question: What should be done before a prisoner is released from custody after serving a short term or before being sent off to prison, according to the policy?

options.b: The prisoner should be released immediately without any further procedures
options.c: Diet should be ordered and served before release

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.10.9.

questions.question: According to the policy, when can the police arrest a person for being under the influence of alcohol or drugs while in charge of a vehicle?

options.a: Only if they cause an accident
options.b: Only if they are involved in a police chase
options.c: Whenever they are in charge of a motor vehicle on a road or other public place and are under the influence
options.d: Never, as it is not within police jurisdiction

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.11.1.

questions.question: What should the police do when an accused person is taken into custody for driving under the influence of alcohol?

options.b: Inform the accused that no medical examination will be conducted
options.c: Follow specific procedures including informing the accused about a medical examination by a doctor

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.11.2.

questions.question: According to the policy, how many persons should be detailed to guard a hospitalized prisoner under police guard?

options.d: It depends on the hospital's request

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 8.12.3.

questions.question: When a prisoner requires private medical attention, what procedure must be followed to ensure the security of the lock-up is not compromised?

options.b: The prisoner must be released temporarily
options.c: Detailed security vetting and risk analysis of the medical practitioner must be conducted
options.d: The prisoner must be taken to a public hospital

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.13.2.

questions.question: What must be done when a medical practitioner is allowed to examine or treat a prisoner in custody, according to the policy?

options.b: The medical practitioner should not be allowed near the prisoner
options.c: The medical practitioner must be searched before entering the facility
options.d: The medical practitioner must be allowed to examine the prisoner without any restrictions

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.13.5.

questions.question: What should the Custody Officer or Sub-Officer in charge Lock-ups ensure regarding prisoners and their legal representatives?

options.a: Prisoners have no right to legal representation
options.b: Prisoners should not be allowed legal visits
options.c: Prisoners' legal representatives should be allowed to visit them
options.d: Prisoners' legal representatives should be searched upon arrival

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.14 Attorneyâ€™s Visits to Prisoner.
